00025 
00026 /// \brief
00027 /// The FdoDataType enumeration lists all of the base data types supported by FDO.
00028 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Boolean">
00029 /// Represents a Boolean value of true or false
00030 /// </param>
00031 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Byte">
00032 /// Represents unsigned 8-bit integers with values between 0 and 255
00033 /// </param>
00034 /// <param name="FdoDataType_DateTime">
00035 /// Represents a date and time value
00036 /// </param>
00037 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Decimal">
00038 /// Represents values ranging from 1.0 x 10^-28 to approximately 7.9 x 10^28, 
00039 /// with 28-29 significant digits
00040 /// </param>
00041 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Double">
00042 /// Represents a floating point value ranging from approximately 5.0 
00043 /// x 10^-324 to 1.7 x 10^308 with a precision of 15-16 digits
00044 /// </param>
00045 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Int16">
00046 /// Represents signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767
00047 /// </param>
00048 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Int32">
00049 /// Represents signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 and 2147483647
00050 /// </param>
00051 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Int64">
00052 /// Represents signed 64-bit integers with values between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807
00053 /// </param>
00054 /// <param name="FdoDataType_Single">
00055 /// Represents floating point values ranging from approximately 1.5 x 10^-45
00056 /// to 3.4 x 10^38, with a precision of 7 digits
00057 /// </param>
00058 /// <param name="FdoDataType_String">
00059 /// Represents a Unicode character string
00060 /// </param>
00061 /// <param name="FdoDataType_BLOB">
00062 /// Represents a binary large object stored as a collection of bytes
00063 /// </param>
00064 /// <param name="FdoDataType_CLOB">
00065 /// Represents a character large object stored as a collection of
00066 /// characters
00067 /// </param>
00068 enum FdoDataType
00069 {
00070     /// Represents a Boolean value of true or false.
00071     FdoDataType_Boolean,
00072 
00073     /// Represents unsigned 8-bit integers with values between 0 and 255.
00074     FdoDataType_Byte,
00075 
00076     /// Represents a date and time value.
00077     FdoDataType_DateTime,
00078 
00079     /// Represents values ranging from 1.0 x 10^-28 to approximately 7.9 x 10^28
00080     /// with 28-29 significant digits.
00081     FdoDataType_Decimal,
00082 
00083     /// Represents a floating point value ranging from approximately 5.0 
00084     /// x 10^-324 to 1.7 x 10^308 with a precision of 15-16 digits.
00085     FdoDataType_Double,
00086 
00087     /// Represents signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767.
00088     FdoDataType_Int16,
00089 
00090     /// Represents signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 
00091     /// and 2147483647.
00092     FdoDataType_Int32,
00093 
00094     /// Represents signed 64-bit integers with values 
00095     /// between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807.
00096     FdoDataType_Int64,
00097 
00098     /// Represents floating point values ranging from approximately 1.5 x 10^-45
00099     /// to 3.4 x 10^38, with a precision of 7 digits. 
00100     FdoDataType_Single,
00101 
00102     /// Represents a Unicode character strings.
00103     FdoDataType_String,
00104 
00105     /// Represents a binary large object stored as a collection of bytes.
00106     FdoDataType_BLOB,
00107 
00108     /// Represents a character large object stored as a collection of
00109     /// characters.
00110     FdoDataType_CLOB,
00111 };
00112 #endif
